sanskrit_verse:
स्वां प्रसूतिं चरित्रं च कुलमात्मानमेव च ।
स्वं च धर्मं प्रयत्नेन जायां रक्षन् हि रक्षति ॥ ९.७॥
transliteration:
svāṃ prasūtiṃ caritraṃ ca kulam ātmānam eva ca |
svaṃ ca dharmam prayatnena jāyāṃ rakṣan hi rakṣati || 9.7||
sph_interpretive_translation: He who protects his wife safeguards his progeny, conduct, lineage, Self, and Dharma through dedicated effort.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the integrity of relational responsibility
Causation arises through preservation of foundational dharmic units
Capacity-based responsibility is rooted in conscious relational stewardship
Restoration logic operates through protection of primary dharmic bonds
Consciousness alignment occurs via honoring inherent relational dharmas
executable_legal_axioms: IF a husband fails to protect his wife, THEN the foundational dharma-unit is compromised and requires restoration
IF lineage continuity is endangered due to neglect of spousal dharma, THEN automatic reintegration protocols must activate
IF personal dharma is violated through spousal disharmony, THEN capacity restoration precedes legal acknowledgment
IF societal dharma collapses, trace root cause to breakdown in spousal dharmic alignment
IF self-governance falters, THEN spousal dharma misalignment is a primary indicator requiring corrective alignment
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating family law matters, the Supreme Court must recognize that violation of spousal dharma destabilizes not only individual lives but also the broader constitutional order. The threshold of responsibility lies in the capacity to uphold relational dharma, not in punitive enforcement. Authority derives from alignment with foundational dharmic structures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that disharmony in spousal dharma disrupts sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) of social and spiritual order. Responsibility is proportional to one's capacity to restore harmony without invoking punitive measures. Truth is established not by blame, but by reestablishing dharmic alignment through conscious action.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate spousal dharma completion process through guided dialogue and mutual vow renewal
Assign responsibility assumption protocol to both parties based on capacity assessment
Activate ancestral lineage reconnection practices to restore contextual awareness
Implement daily dharmic synchronization rituals to realign relational consciousness
Deploy community-based witness systems to support ongoing dharmic reaffirmation
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Protection of spousal dharma restores all dharmas. Reality is non-punitive; consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
